result.execSummary:
The defendant Octavius Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Pay all costs, assessments, fees and surcharges to be paid by 08/29/16 or a civil judgment to be entered. Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm, body armor and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Octavius Carter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Octavius Carter in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Octavius Carter in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Defendant has been revoked twice on probation.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 17 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply fpr work.  Court orders the payment of all costs, assessments, fees and surcharges to be paid by 8-29-2016 or a civil forfeiture to be entered.  Defendant remanded.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.

Defendant Octavius Carter in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Octavius Carter in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm, body armor and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. 

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Report. 

Case adjourned to branch 38 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Octavius Carter not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
FILE NOT IN COURT.  Upon the motion of defense counsel, with no objection by the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Case 2015CM388 and 2015CM1593.  Today, the State extended a global offer to defense, which remain open until 8-5-2015.  All parties are notified as of 8-3-2015, this case will be assigned to Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 8-12-2015 at 8:15 am.   mld

Defendant Octavius Carter in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is in receipt of all the discovery.  Defense is rejecting the offer of the State.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-12-2015 at 8:30 am.   All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Melissa M., no weapons in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Octavius Carter in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-17-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Melissa M., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

15RM004019  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-29-2015

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Melissa M.

Defendant Octavius Carter in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Octavius Carter in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Octavius Carter
Current: 5123 N. Villard Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 01-29-2015)
Prior: 9323 West Birch Avenue #1, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
